PromotionLaunched.description: The "PromotionLaunched" event indicates that a new marketing promotion or discount campaign has been activated. This event includes details such as the promotion ID, start and end dates, discount rates, and applicable product categories. Triggering this event updates the platformâ€™s marketing systems, informs customers about the promotion, and adjusts pricing and promotional displays across the website and other sales channels.

OrderReceived.description: The "OrderReceived" signifies the successful placement of a customer order. When this event is triggered, it carries essential details about the order, including customer information, order items, quantities, and payment status. This event initiates subsequent processes such as inventory reservation, payment confirmation, and order processing, ensuring timely and efficient handling of the order across various integrated systems within the platform.

OrderPlaced.description: The "OrderPlaced" event signifies that a customer has successfully submitted an order. This event includes details such as the order request ID, customer information, items ordered, quantities, and payment status. Triggering this event initiates subsequent processes, including inventory checks, payment processing, and order fulfillment, ensuring that the order is properly handled and tracked throughout its lifecycle.

OrderAccepted.description: The "OrderAccepted" event indicates that an order has been reviewed and confirmed for processing. This event includes details such as the order ID, customer information, and the confirmation status. Triggering this event updates the system to move the order to the next stage in the fulfillment process, such as inventory allocation or preparation for shipping, and informs relevant systems and stakeholders of the order's acceptance.

ReadyToSell.description: The "ReadyToSell" event indicates that a product is now fully prepared for sale. This event includes details such as the product ID, inventory status, and any relevant pricing or promotion information. Triggering this event updates the product catalog to reflect its availability for purchase, notifies customers and sales channels, and ensures that the product is actively featured and available for transactions.

OrderShipped.description: The "OrderShipped" event signifies that an order has been dispatched from the warehouse and is on its way to the customer. This event includes details such as the shipping carrier, tracking number, and estimated delivery date. Triggering this event updates the customer with shipping information, adjusts inventory records, and may trigger notifications to keep all relevant systems and stakeholders informed about the order's status.

OrderProcessed.description: The "OrderProcessed" event indicates that an order has been successfully processed and is ready for the next stage, such as shipping or delivery. This event provides details about the processed order, including its status, any updates to inventory, and shipping information. Triggering this event allows systems to initiate or update shipping procedures, notify customers of order status, and manage inventory levels, ensuring a smooth transition through the fulfillment cycle.

info.description: The Order Management System (OMS) in the Acme - ECommerce platform is responsible for overseeing the entire lifecycle of customer orders. It handles order placement, processing, tracking, and fulfillment. The OMS integrates with other systems such as inventory management, payment gateways, and shipping services to automate and streamline workflows. It ensures accurate order processing, updates order statuses in real-time, manages returns and exchanges, and provides customer service teams with essential information to address inquiries and issues effectively.
info.title: Order Management System
